title: No Arrests in Charlie Kirk’s Killing as FBI Seeks Help From Public
summary: After a day of hunting for a suspect in the assassination, investigators pleaded for help from the public.

title: Bolsonaro Convicted of Attempting a Coup in Brazil, Sentenced to 27 Years in Prison
summary: Brazil’s Supreme Court convicted the former president of trying to cling to power after losing the 2022 election, including a plan to assassinate his opponent.

title: In Public and in Private, New York Marks 9/11 Anniversary
summary: The names of those killed in the Sept. 11, 2001, terrorist attacks were read at a memorial plaza in Lower Manhattan. Other remembrances took place across the region.

title: What to Know About the 9/11 Case at Guantánamo Bay
summary: A guide to the military prison, the prisoners, the costs and what else goes on at the U.S. naval base.

title: $10 Million in Contraceptives Have Been Destroyed on Orders From Trump Officials
summary: The birth control pills, IUDs and hormonal implants were purchased by U.S.A.I.D. for women in low-income countries. They had been in limbo in a Belgian warehouse after the U.S. cut much of its foreign aid.

title: Trump Asks Appeals Court to Allow Firing of Lisa Cook Ahead of Key Fed Meeting
summary: The government filed an emergency request after a lower court prevented the president from firing Ms. Cook as the case proceeds.

title: CPI Shows Pace of US Inflation Likely to Keep Fed Cautious on Rate Cuts
summary: The central bank is likely to lower borrowing costs at its meeting next week amid budding concerns about the labor market.

title: Did a Brooklyn Couple Kill a Neighbor’s Trees for a Better View in Maine?
summary: Maine’s Board of Pesticides Control says two summer residents poisoned a neighbor’s trees so the couple, both Martha Stewart associates, could have a harbor view. They deny it.

title: Student Who Shot 2 Others at Colorado School Was ‘Radicalized,’ Officials Say
summary: Desmond Holly, 16, who is suspected of shooting and critically injuring two students, had been “radicalized by an extremist network,” the authorities said.

title: Mamdani Says He Will Apologize for Calling the N.Y.P.D. Racist in 2020
summary: Zohran Mamdani, a democratic socialist who won the mayoral primary, said the department was racist and homophobic in a social media post.

title: Mamdani Meets Bloomberg, Once a Sworn Foe, for a ‘Cordial’ Discussion
summary: Michael R. Bloomberg, who spent $8 million trying to torpedo Zohran Mamdani’s Democratic primary bid, advised him on how to fill key City Hall positions.

title: On Ukraine and Gaza, Trump Casts Himself as a Bystander, if He Can’t Be a Peacemaker
summary: President Trump often insists he can bring peace to global conflicts. But when allies and adversaries alike appear to be ignoring him or testing American will, he adopts a what-can-you-do shrug.

title: U.S. Joins U.N. Security Council’s Criticism of Israeli Strike in Qatar
summary: The United States, ordinarily a protector of Israel at the United Nations, signed on to a statement condemning its attack on Hamas in the Qatari capital.

title: Paramount Plans Bid for Warner Bros. Discovery
summary: Any deal would further reshape the media industry, putting CBS News, CNN and two major movie studios under the same corporate umbrella.

title: Nepal’s Capital Is Choked With Smoke and Gripped by Fear
summary: With institutions burned to the ground and the army in control, Gen Z protesters are pushing for an anti-corruption crusader to be appointed as the country’s interim leader.

title: Nepal’s Social Media Ban Backfires as Citizens Nominate New Leader in Chat Room
summary: After days of violent protest led to the government’s collapse, thousands of citizens gather virtually to debate their nation’s future.

title: Erich Sailer, Ski Coach Who Helped Shape Champions, Dies at 99
summary: Using a modest slope in Minnesota as a springboard, he tutored a host of rising stars, including Lindsey Vonn. He was inducted into the U.S. Ski and Snowboard Hall of Fame.

title: Charlie Kirk Was Practicing Politics the Right Way
summary: The foundation of a free society is the ability to participate in politics without fear of violence. To lose that is to risk losing everything.

title: How Charlie Kirk Remade Campus Conservatism
summary: He was a spokesman for a movement that seemed both more rebellious and more normal.

title: The F.B.I. Asked for Help Finding Charlie Kirk’s Killer
summary: Also, new numbers showed a rise in inflation. Here’s the latest at the end of Thursday.

title: U.S. Naval Academy Placed Under Lockdown Amid Threats, Authorities Say
summary: Local law enforcement officers were responding to the campus in Annapolis, Md., a spokesman said.

title: Carney Unveils Major Projects for Canada to Offset Damage of Trump’s Tariffs
summary: Prime Minister Mark Carney unveiled big infrastructure plans. But they are likely to meet resistance from Indigenous and environmental groups.

title: California Passes Bill Allowing Omission of Patients’ Names From Abortion Pill Bottles
summary: The intent is to protect health care providers who send the pills to patients in states with abortion bans, and to reassure patients who fear they could be identified.

title: Jerry Seinfeld Compares ‘Free Palestine’ Movement to K.K.K., Report Says
summary: The comments at a Duke University event this week have rankled student activists, who said they fostered a hostile environment on campus.
